The message is clear: The People want Medicare for All.  Let me be clear: When I am your U.S. Senator from Maine, I will fight for #MedicareForAll. Chip in today: http://bit.ly/Sweet-m4a-fb

We are in the final few months of this U.S. Senate primary. It is so important that we remain focused on our mission -- unseating U.S. Senator Susan Collins.  Thanks to her, Brett Kavanaugh now sits on the U.S. Supreme Court, which is hearing oral arguments today on a case (June Medical Service v Russo) that could set in motion an eventual overturning of Roe v. Wade.  Reproductive rights are human rights, and when I am your U.S. Senator from #Maine, I will fight for you and all of us to ensure we have safe, affordable and legal access to #reproductive services all across this country. #junevrusso
I always feel Election Day is like Christmas! It is so exciting that we get the honor of voting in this most critical of all elections. Get out there today and VOTE! #supertuesday  #gotv
Feelin’ the Bern and some Thelma and Louise vibes tonight at the #gotv Bernie Sanders rally in Portland with my friend Susan Sarandon! #bernie2020 #betsyforbernie

Lifesaving measures such as background checks, Red Flag Bills, safe storage & assault weapons bans have the overwhelming support of Americans, including Mainers.  It’s time our elected officials stop playing to the NRA. When I'm Senator, I'll fight for common sense gun laws.
I appreciate Bernie’s compassion and relentlessness in standing up for what is right over four decades. Whether it be ending endless wars, enacting  or explaining how a g movements for change.

1 in 4 Americans with diabetes have said they have rationed insulin. No one should die because they can't afford life-saving medication. We must take on the greed of Big Pharma, and lower the costs prescription drugs. https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/02/24/magazine/big-pharmas-unconscionable-insulin-racket-endangers-people-with-diabetes/

It's time that we have an honest discussion on pursuing reparations.   When I'm Senator, I will push for a commission to study and propose comprehensive, restorative action for not only black Americans, but indigenous peoples as well.

Abortion is basic health care. When we pass #MedicareforAll, we will provide comprehensive reproductive care in every corner of the country, ensuring that every person has a right to control their own body.

Our criminal justice system is broken. We must reform it by: -ending the War on Drugs -ending cash bail -banning for-profit prison and detention centers -focusing on rehabilitation over punishment whenever possible

Marijuana prohibition has served to destroy lives and communities, while raking in profits for the private prison industry. It's time to legalize marijuana and expunge the records of those sitting in jails for marijuana offenses.

We are facing an epidemic of transviolence in this country. Last year, advocates recorded at least 22 deaths of transgender or gender non-conforming people in the U.S. All but one were people of color.  Trans rights are human rights, and we must fight for those rights.

8 years ago, Trayvon Martin was walking home after a trip to the convenience store. He never made it. Because of Florida's Stand Your Ground law, his killer walked free.  We must honor Trayvon by fighting against racism in all its forms, and by passing common sense gun laws.

My heart goes out to the victims and families of this shooting in Milwaukee. But thoughts and prayers are not enough. As the next U.S. Senator from Maine, I pledge to fight every day to end senseless gun violence in America.

The #opioidcrisis has claimed the life of nearly one Mainer per day in 2019, devastating so many families all over the state.  We must end the War on Drugs, move away from incarceration and focus on care and healing.

Trump's immigration policy is a humanitarian crisis.  We must end the dehumanization of immigrants, and fight for comprehensive, compassionate immigration reform. https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/5dmw5x/doctors-have-a-name-for-separating-kids-from-their-parents-at-the-border-its-torture?utm_source=reddit.com

Our bees are declining due to many factors: pesticides, drought, habitat destruction, air pollution. These all have one thing in common -- humans. In order to save the bees, we need to save our planet. The only way we can do that is with a #GreenNewDeal. https://bangordailynews.com/2020/02/01/homestead/how-maine-beekeepers-are-helping-to-improve-bee-production-and-health-across-the-nation/

22 studies agree: #MedicareforAll will provide comprehensive health care for every American while saving our country trillions.  No insurance company should make a profit off of people’s suffering. This country needs Medicare For All.  https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/healthcare/484301-22-studies-agree-medicare-for-all-saves-money?amp

Environmental justice means ensuring all people have a healthy environment where they live, regardless of race, income, or education.  I’m fighting for a #GreenNewDeal because our most vulnerable shouldn’t suffer the most pollution or worst health outcomes.
Trump’s zero-tolerance immigration policy is cruel and inhumane. We must stop family separation, reunite families and abolish private detention facilities.

Today in America, we have more people in jail than any other country.  It is a travesty that companies are making a profit by locking people up. It’s time to ban private prisons and detention centers. https://www.sentencingproject.org/publications/private-prisons-united-states/
Celebrating this amazing class of emerge graduates including spectacular Alyssa (who invited me) Marwa, Dena , Sari, and so many friends.  Fierce, heart centered and ready to change the world!

We entrust teachers with educating our children, but refuse to pay them what they deserve. We are the wealthiest country in the world. It’s time to pay our teachers for their work. http://neatoday.org/2019/07/25/teachers-second-jobs/

Donald Trump campaigned on a simple promise: “We won’t be touching your Social Security.”  He lied. His new budget would cut Social Security benefits by $30 billion.  When I am in Washington, not only will we protect your Social Security benefits, we will expand them.

As an advocate for community mental health services for over 20 years this finally makes the case for community based services as the foundation to help us prevent the opioid crisis and incarceration of people instead of treatment, and enhances the power of consumer/ peer services. Trump is packing migrants into overcrowded cells for days, with no medical attention, showers or adequate food.  This man is a brutal tyrant. When we're in the Senate, his border crimes will never receive a yes vote from me. https://www.courthousenews.com/judge-orders-feds-to-give-immigrant-detainees-food-blankets-showers/

The healthcare system in this country is working as it was designed: to make a profit for the insurance industry.  Our healthcare system isn't broken, it’s fixed.  #MedicareForAll is not just the most cost-efficient plan; it's the morally correct one. https://www.newsweek.com/medicare-all-would-save-450-billion-annually-while-preventing-68000-deaths-new-study-shows-1487862

The United States has one of the lowest voter turnouts of any industrialized country. We need to make voting accessible to everyone.  When I'm in the Senate, I will introduce a bill to make Election Day a federal holiday. https://www.pewresearch.org/fact-tank/2018/05/21/u-s-voter-turnout-trails-most-developed-countries/

I applaud Lyft Drivers for helping people get to the polls. But this doesn't address the true problem: working people often don't have the time to vote in the first place.  It's time to make Election Day a federal holiday. https://www.cnet.com/news/lyft-is-offering-free-rides-for-2020-primary-and-election-voters/?utm_source=reddit.com

Medicare For All Who Want It is a covert way of saying the wealthiest and healthiest Americans won’t have to contribute to the single-payer pool, and that insurance corporations won’t see their profits harmed.  It’s a sham policy that won't work. We need #MedicareForAll.  https://www.msnbc.com/katy-tur/watch/new-study-shows-medicare-for-all-would-save-lives-78899269941

I had so much fun yesterday at the Thompson’s Ice Harvesting Festival! They harvest ice the old fashioned way, store it in the barn, and then use it to make ice cream on the 4th of July. Thank you, Kate, for sharing this with me!

25 percent of mothers in the U.S. return to work just 10 days after giving birth. 17 percent of Americans spend more than twenty hours a week caring for sick relatives.   Our working families deserve better. When I’m Senator, we’re passing .

We have a housing crisis in America. We must tackle it before it’s too late.  Nearly a third of U.S. households are paying MORE than 30% of their income just to keep a roof over their head. Washington has compromised with landlords for long enough. We need #RentControlNow.

As a single Mom who raised 3 kids, I know the cost of childcare can force many parents into impossible situations. In the last 40 yrs, the cost has risen 2000%. In Maine, child care can run $11,000 per year. That's criminal. We need #UniversalChildCare. https://www.newscentermaine.com/article/life/family/surviving-maines-daycare-desert/97-300cef1e-8183-4f27-9ccb-3d82164d5f46

The Violence Against Women Act expired a year ago. Violence threatens women's lives every day. It’s worse for indigenous women, as tribal courts are prohibited from trying non-native assailants. When I’m Senator, we'll restore the #VAWA – and tribes will have full sovereignty.

Trump's budget is a cruel and calculated assault on an already weakened social safety net for low-income Americans. Congress must reject it.  https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2020/02/trump-isnt-waging-a-war-on-poverty-hes-waging-a-war-on-poor-people/

Over 100,000 Mainers suffer from well water tainted by arsenic, which is linked to learning disabilities and bladder cancer. Yet wells are exempt from testing requirements. Throughout my entire career, I have never backed down from a fight. Healthcare for all. Equal rights. Justice for victims of domestic violence and substance abuse. Protecting our environment from toxic poisons. These are fights I’ve tackled head-on. I’ve been a champion for the underrepresented in Maine, and I’m ready to keep fighting as we build a grassroots movement to deliver solutions to the big problems facing our country.

Big money in our political system poisons not only our democracy, but our economy. The ultra rich and super PACs don’t dig into their deep pockets to “express a viewpoint,” they do so in an effort to reshape our economy through policy. Tax cuts for billionaires. Gutting education and infrastructure. Subsidizing the fossil fuel companies that poison the planet. These are a few ways those at the very top rig the economy into a money machine for themselves, and make it an uphill battle for the rest of us.

1 in 5 emergency room visits result in a surprise bill. These bills can run into the thousands of dollars, leaving working families reeling.  These surprise bills occur because hospitals contract physicians who don’t share their insurance arrangements, or they use the threat of surprise billing to negotiate higher prices from insurance companies.  Working families are not bargaining chips. It’s time for #MedicareForAll.

Yesterday marked the 27th anniversary of the passage of the nationwide Family Medical Leave Act. I helped write the first  in the country in 1986, delivering economic justice to thousands of working families here in Maine.  No one thought it was possible, but we made it possible. We provided safety and job security for working Mainers and their families. I believe now, as I did then, that we will never achieve justice in this country without investing in the working class.   It is unconscionable that families in this country are still buried in debt and losing their jobs just to care for their loved ones. Join us in our fight for .  Sign here:

Trump’s health care plan is a prescription for disaster. It’s like offering a band aid to a person with a broken leg. The only solution to our healthcare crisis is a single-payer system.

Now it's official. Senator Collins has just voted to acquit Trump on both counts. We need a Senator who will stand up for democracy, and protect the Constitution and the rule of law. You will always be able to count on me for that. Always. al.  More than 3 million Americans aged 60 and older currently owe more than $86 billion in unpaid student loans, according to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.  Many retirees who default on these loans can have their Social Security benefits garnished at a rate of 15 percent.   Experts believe that student loan defaults have the potential to trigger another recession. This is a crisis that touches every one of us, whether we carry the debt burden or not.  It's time to cancel student debt.   SIGN HERE:

20 percent of adult Americans carry student loan debt.   That’s right. One in five adults have student loans.  Student loan debt has soared from $260 billion in 2004 to $1.6 trillion as of 2019. The average undergraduate student’s debt burden is $38,000, and that’s just the principal before interest.  This is a crisis of catastrophic proportions. And we need to tackle it, before it’s too late.  Join me in the fight to cancel student debt.  SIGN HERE:

It is simply transforming our current health care system – one that we are all currently paying for in multiple ways – into one where no one has to decide between paying rent and seeing a doctor." https://www.pressherald.com/2019/12/21/betsy-sweet-medicare-for-all-is-the-only-solution-to-the-u-s-health-care-crisis/ #mepol #mepolitics #wickedsweet

Today, the Supreme Court rejected a challenge to a Kentucky law requiring doctors to describe ultrasound images and play fetal heartbeat audio to women seeking abortions. This medically-unnecessary law has no basis in medicine or science. The only thing it does is shame people for seeking abortion services.  This is another striking blow for #abortion rights. We have Senator Susan Collins to thank for this. Rather than listen to her constituents who begged her to reject Justice Brett Kavanaugh, a deeply anti-abortion judge, she towed the party line.  Sign this petition to tell Susan Collins: Your time is up. #mepol #kypol #mepolitics #kypolitics

text: Proud to be endorsed by Women for Justice - NorthEast Region! #mepol #mepolitics #wickedsweetWomen For Justice is proud to endorse Maine's Betsy Sweet for U.S. Senate.   Betsy is a proven champion for the people. She's not taking special interest $$$, so please show her some grassroots support.  https://betsysweet.com https://twitter.com/betsysweetme https://www.instagram.com/betsysweetme

Under a , Maine’s natural resources will work to our advantage, helping us lead the way in providing tidal, solar, wind, and hydroelectric energy production.   We will end the $20 billion our government spends each year subsidizing the fossil fuel industry, and invest instead in green technologies and infrastructure that will grow our economy and keep our planet alive.   This would make Maine a leader not only in renewable energy production, but in training the workforce of the future.  There is no time to wait.   Sign our petition today to demand a Green New Deal.

When we talk about a , we are talking about:  Transitioning to 100% renewable energy (and Maine is poised to lead in production and research and development) Training fossil fuel industry workers for a new energy economy Ending the $20 Billion we give to the fossil fuel industry in taxpayer dollars each year and using it to develop sustainable green technology Investing in public infrastructure that is safe, efficient and green Work to protect our public lands and water  The world cannot wait any longer. Half measures will not suffice. The time for incrementalism has passed.

I was 6 years old when Rachel Carson’s “Silent Spring” sounded a warning for all species on this planet. I first read it in my late teens, but I learned about its truths as a child when my grandmother and my mother told me about the osprey and eagles disappearing from North Haven, where my grandparents lived.  Now, even more birds are at risk of dying off because of our collective inaction in dealing with #climatechange. If birds are at risk, so are so many other species on this planet, including us, and we have no time for tepid, middle-of-the-road responses to this crisis. That’s why I support a Green New Deal. As citizens of this country, as voters, we must not tolerate platitudes that call for “bold action” on climate change but stop short of embracing a #GreenNewDeal. We have to demand more from our leaders. #mepol #mepolitics #gnd #maine http://ow.ly/GVXe50xq12R

For too long, our criminal justice system has used marijuana prohibition as a weapon to destroy lives - especially for people of color and poor people, obliterate communities, and rake in obscene profits for the private prison industry. Senator Susan Collins doesn't seem to mind. She's already said she will not support a federal effort to decriminalize marijuana. She even refuses to recognize Maine's decision to end our statewide ban, despite voters passing a legalization initiative in 2016. Susan Collins is done listening to us. Join me in making this her last term.

This campaign is about more than Betsy Sweet. It is a movement towards a more compassionate, more just society. Yesterday, in Brewer, I met with Jack, from Food AND Medicine to talk about the importance of addressing structural change. They do extraordinary work.. and sponsor the Solidarity Harvest, providing meals for 10,000 Mainers with the Eastern Maine Labor Council.  Listen and help !  Thanks. #solidarityharvest Sponsor a Meal:  https://actionnetwork.org/fundraising/2019-solidarity-harvest-sponsor-a-meal Support Food AND Medicine's work / Become a Member: https://actionnetwork.org/fundraising/become-a-member #solidarityharvest

I am honored to have been able to spend the afternoon helping prepare Thanksgiving meal ingredients with Food AND Medicine and so many selfless volunteers in Brewer today. In all, this #solidarityharvest will feed 13,000 people in Maine this holiday. But what I love most about this group is that they also tackle the structural issues Mainers face everyday— from public transportation to energy production, and they work tirelessly on behalf of people all across this state. Stay tuned for a video tomorrow and learn more about this nonprofit organization!

An Amazing day yesterday in Bangor and Orono - great meetings and wonderful people.  Getting to congratulate Angela Okafor and Marwa Elkelani at the culture fest on their historic elections was a total highlight.  Our smiles say it all (with Laurie Osher too!)
My first job out of college was knocking on doors to support the equal rights amendment. That was in 1978. The time is way past due for this basic piece of legislation to become law

And finished off at the amazing Health Equity Alliance Dinner celebrating all their excellent work and seeing my friend Ron King who started it years ago as the Downeast AIDS Alliance.  Thanks to Laurie Osher for spending the day with me!  The campaign trail doesn’t get much better than this.  My heart is full ❤️
Then a great house party hosted by the fabulous town councilor Laurie Osher where we talked health care, foreign policy and winning...
And then an incredible victory hugs with Marwa Elkelani and Angela Okafor in their incredible races in Bangor ...

What an extraordinary day.  Completely joyful and a “10” of a day.  Started at the global cultural fest in Orono .. hundreds of people learning about and tasting food from many different countries.. incredible diversity in Orono/Bangor and then... (see next post)
We are all going to need this!

It's never too early to plant seeds of Democracy! This morning I planted daffodil bulbs with students at Hall-Dale Elementary in Hallowell as part of the Maine Suffrage Centennial honoring Maine ratification of women's right to vote in 1919.  The kids all knew about the suffragettes, and it was so exciting to do this one day after an election where so many women ran, won, and voted! #unitedwebloom #mainesuffragecentennial #suffragists #votesforwomen

Thank you for this Letter to the Editor, John! It's be great getting to know you and so many Mainers on the campaign trail! "The more I’ve gotten to learn about and know Betsy Sweet, the more impressed I am. She has more years of experience working to get laws passed to help people with real-life problems, effectively bilaterally, with all the stakeholders — more than any other candidate running in Maine in 2020 for the U.S. Senate seat. I have been following her politically since the governor’s race and her speech last January at the Women’s March in Portland. However, I really didn’t realize the depth of her knowledge, commitment and understand of Maine’s diverse needs and issues until last week when I heard with a group of voters and spoke to her in person." #MePol #MePolitics #MeLeg #BetsySweetME https://www.centralmaine.com/2019/11/04/take-a-look-at-sweet-for-us-senate/

One year from today, Mainers will go to the polls and choose their Senator for the next six years. That election will likely decide which party controls the Senate. We cannot allow a Republican majority in the Senate in 2021, even if a Democrat wins the Presidency.

Democracy at work!  Make your opinion known.A few weeks ago, I called for a public hearing on the CMP transmission line. I'm happy to announce that Mainers will get the opportunity to make their voices heard.  *The Army Corps of Engineers will hold a public hearing in Lewiston on December 5th.* More info here: https://golden.house.gov/media/press-releases/golden-s-letter-army-corps-engineers-yields-public-hearing-cmp-line-release I applaud the Army Corps of Engineers for their willingness to be open and transparent. You can read the hearing notice and find more details on submitting questions and comments here: https://www.nae.usace.army.mil/Missions/Regulatory/PublicNotices/

It’s not just Kavanaugh.U.S. Senator Susan Collins "In a confirmation decided along party lines, Senator Susan Collins voted Thursday to appoint 37-year-old Justin Walker, a University of Louisville law professor who received a “not qualified” rating from the American Bar Association, to the U.S. District Court for the Western District of Kentucky." http://mainebeacon.com/collins-backs-not-qualified-trump-judicial-nominee-who-stumped-for-kavanaugh/

What a beautiful, full weekend with my girls.  They are all thriving, doing good in the world, are kind and fun(ny).  I was a bit teary watching Dani’s senior game.  Realized I have been watching my strong, athletic, team player girls for 21 years, in every season.  This was the last game I’ll see .  Sports are not everything but for us it has meant community, fitness, team and leadership building, service, mentoring, discipline, dedication... all good life skills.  Many thanks to all the coaches, teammates, parents and friends that have made this part of our family’s life so rewarding.
